snippet: About 390,000 foreign-born people were deported last year, according to the Department of Homeland Security, which is on track for similar figures for fiscal 2012.
abstract: Homeland Security Dept reports that immigration enforcement authorities detained and deported record numbers of illegal immigrants in 2011 and are on track for similar figures in 2012, even as the numbers of migrants crossing the border illegally dropped to a 40-year low.
lead_paragraph: About 390,000 foreign-born people were deported last year, according to the Department of Homeland Security, which is on track for similar figures for fiscal 2012.

headline.seo: U.S. Deports Record Number of Foreigners in 2011
headline.main: Record Number of Foreigners Were Deported in 2011, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Record Number of Foreigners Were Deported in 2011, Officials Say
